issue.title: www.androidpolice.com

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.androidpolice.com/disney-gets-a-price-hike-that-starts-soon/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.androidpolice.com%2Fdisney-gets-a-price-hike-that-starts-soon%2F) ### Comment > Issue was reported over 2 weeks ago here: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/213313 > > Was ignored for over a week until eventually someone bothered to test it, and "couldn't reproduce" it. > > Added a different URL and screenshot (it happens on every URL) and was more specific with filter list and extension settings this time. This is on Chrome, so Manifest v3. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/6r1hn6sh2v40gww8c4sscck8wkkgwkodibsn865lso.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v5.1.141 System version: | `Windows 11` Browser: | Chrome Tracking protection: | **General settings**:
Block trackers,
Strip URLs from tracking parameters Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection,
AdGuard URL Tracking

Social widgets:
AdGuard Social Media

Annoyances:
AdGuard Cookie Notices,
AdGuard Popups Browsing Security: | disabled Browsing Security statistics: | disabled ### Issue configuration [Import](https://reports.adguard.com/settings/import.html?product_type=ext&product_version=5.1.141&system_version=Windows+11&browser=chrome&filters=2.3.17.4.18.19&browsing_security.enabled=false&browsing_security.statistics_enabled=false&stealth.enabled=true&stealth.strip_url=true&stealth.block_trackers=true)

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.androidpolice.com/disney-gets-a-price-hike-that-starts-soon/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.androidpolice.com%2Fdisney-gets-a-price-hike-that-starts-soon%2F) ### Comment > https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/214117 > > I tried to force update, it would not. I decided to uninstall the extension. When I tried to install it again, I now get an error (see the screenshot). > > Seems like I'm not the only one: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/issues/3317 > > Very unprofessional. Now I'm forced to move to a different ad blocker as yours isn't even compatible with Chrome anymore. Chrome 140.0.7339.208 ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/2a5xsszvnheso8wkgskkwg8g0k88k0491vw29hd9iw.png?nc=1)

Block trackers,

AdGuard Base

AdGuard Social Media

Annoyances:
AdGuard Cookie Notices,
AdGuard Popups

Other:
Filter unblocking search ads and self-promotion Browsing Security: | disabled Browsing Security statistics: | disabled Other extensions used: | `None` ### Issue configuration [Import](https://reports.adguard.com/settings/import.html?product_type=ext&product_version=5.1.141&system_version=Windows+11&browser=chrome&filters=2.3.17.4.18.19.10&browsing_security.enabled=false&browsing_security.statistics_enabled=false&stealth.enabled=true&stealth.strip_url=true&stealth.block_trackers=true)

comment.body: This error persists; it appears on the screen if you navigate to the next pages on the results page or switch between the site's own tabs. @Alex-302

issue.title: gamewith.jp
issue.body:

comment.body:
I am the one who created this issue.
English translation of the comment → When opening that URL under the following conditions, a blank ad-like frame is generated. It becomes even more noticeable if you use extensions that enable dark mode.
